name: On 'Til Dawn Mattifying Waterproof Setting Spray
about: What it is:A waterproof setting spray that gives skin an all-day matte finish..Highlighted Ingredients:- Green Tea Extract: Helps tighten pores..What Else You Need to Know:With an aerosol spray application that is light as air and non-sticky, this formula sets full beat makeup with next-level hold for up to 16 hours. Featuring texture-solving ingredients to absorb oil and help tighten pores, the spray keeps the glam locked in with a blurred, flawless matte finish.
ingredients: -Green Tea Extract: Helps tighten the look of pores..-Witch Hazel: Absorbs oil for a blurred, matte finish....Butane, Alcohol Denat., Isobutane, Diisopropyl Adipate, Magnesium Carbonate, Alcohol, Methacryloyl Ethyl Betaine/Acrylates Copolymer, Water (Aqua/Eau), Fragrance (Parfum), Hamamelis Virginiana (Witch Hazel) Water, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Panthenol, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Tocopheryl Acetate, Glycerin, Phenoxyethanol, Cucumis Sativus (Cucumber) Fruit Extract, Benzoic Acid, Limonene, Linalool, Hexyl Cinnamal.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Shake well before each use, and keep eyes closed during application. .-Hold 10 to 12 inches away from face, and spray in a circular motion for even distribution on skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: After using the product to kickboxing, fitness class & yoga and my face was perfect after. My hair was worse than my face which never happens! Im addicted and will buy this forever.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brunette hair, Porcelain skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I got the travel size as a gift and I absolutely love it! Slightly annoyed because now I'm hooked on a 60 dollar setting spray lol. This works so well and lasts me an entire day of school, work and hanging out with friends. Your makeup will literally not budge

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, red hair, Fair skin tone
reviews.review_text: The setting spray wouldn’t work when I tried to use it when I just bought it and it was new. I had to shake it every min for it to work. I ended up returning it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: never broke me out and definitely works, it beat the school air and makes my makeup last all day

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: After all of the glowing reviews about this setting spray I thought I'd give it a try. Unfortunately it is not for me. It makes my makeup feel incredibly dry, it doesn't absorb any 'powderyness' if you like to set or bake with powder. Half way through the day my makeup cracks in any areas that my skin moves a lot(under my nose, smile lines, under and around eyes). I haven't tried this with foundation or concealer ONLY, but could see that possibly working better, or being good in really hot, sweaty conditions. The fragrance is a lot for something that you spray on your face which is offputting, and if you open your eyes too soon after spraying it BURNS. This is a big NO for me. Waste of money. And I will forever love my UD All-Nighter.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: 'Hairspray for your face' were my first thoughts after seeing the ad, and it really IS like using a hairspray! I started out with the mini size, loved it and then moved up to the standard size which retails at a slightly expensive $32 for 3.4 oz/143ml. This makeup setting spray keeps its promises, it really does last and then some, which is no easy feat when my skin is at its oiliest! Oil aside, even perspiration barely makes a dent on how well my makeup holds up after using this. Obviously I'm not talking major sweating events, but the amount you'd typically see after a 10 minute walk on a warm/humid day. What I don't like however is the fact that the nozzle gets clogged up and stops dispensing. And after a quick search online, it seems I'm not the first person to be experiencing this either. Unfortunately this makes the remaining product unusable, which wouldn't be such an issue if it didn't cost this much to begin with! I didn't have this issue with the mini size, nor the first full size I went through - which lasted me almost exactly a month. It might be restricted to a particular batch, or it might just be luck of the draw. Either way I'm not taking my chances. Not a repurchase for me, at least not until the issue with the nozzle is taken care of.   ~ My Top 5 Beauty must-have list ~  1. Hair Loss Treatment: ‘Divine Herbal’ - Hair Oil  2. Shampoo: 'Sephora Collection' - Deep Cleaning Shampoo 3. Face Mask: ‘Peter Thomas Roth’ – Pumpkin Enzyme Mask  4. Pigmentation + Anti-Aging Serum: ‘Divine Herbal’ - Facial Treatment Serum 5. Face Scrub: ‘Sisley' - Botanical Gentle Buffing Cream

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was really excited about this product but unfortunately i found it was just like spraying hair spray on my face. I didn’t like it at all. And didn’t feel it held my makeup all day

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: love it keeps my makeup on all day, i went to the beach and got water on my face and still stayed on. but the smell is a bit strong and when u open ur eyes it kinda burns but its ok its not that bad, the scent is not bad either.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brunette hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Keeps your makeup in place for hours! I have tried many others and that is the only one I can really see a difference with!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Okay YES the smell is a little strong like hairspray smell but my makeup does not BUDGE. Seriously looks the same at the start and end of the day!!!! I couldn’t believe it. Best setting spray ever

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is awful primer spray the smell is overwhelming I had to hold my breath and it’s very drying  for my face I will stick with hour glass primer

reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I’ve tried many setting spray and this one is the best ! It last all day and my makeup doesnt move. It does feel like an hairspray, but the product goes evenly on the face, wich I like. It does run out quick tho

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Wanted to love this setting spray based on the reviews. I found the alcohol smell too much and it would stink after I sprayed it on my face.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Olive skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Did not like this product at all. Felt like I was putting hair spray on my face.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Gray eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I use this when I need to last all day! I was in a wedding and this made my makeup last all day and night, this is truly hairspray for your face! With the long lasting effect as well as the smell, that’s the one thing I don’t love

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: New fav setting spray! Kept my makeup on all day and looking flawless for 13+ hours. Even after my run my makeup didn’t budge. It does sorta feel like hairspray when applying, but it’s worth it. Only complaint is that the mine only lasted me a week

reviews.review_text: the fumes are brutal. but it seems to work ok. i’m not blown away by this product at all, like most influencers say they are.

reviews.review_text: It will last, is the best one so far that lasts a night out when your friend even drops the drink and you wash your face. I also recommend using waterproof make just be clear

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: 4 stars because I have to hold my breath when I spray it lol. But I get all the good staying power from it, with (thankfully) none of the bad. Ive read that others are having their makeup split and crack and change in texture... Thank goodness Ive never had that experience! Only the good stuff. I'll continue to purchase

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: The finish and stay is crazy good!! Hold your breath before spraying it on though lol

reviews.review_title: If I could give it a 10 I would!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Gray eyes, brunette hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The few times I've used this, my makeup stayed perfectly. It rained on me, and none of my makeup came off! I swear I'm going to use this till I die, lol.

reviews.review_title: Its a heck NO for me
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Like hairspray, this unfortunately left my makeup in shambles. Makeup started to break and split, and any little tap or brush would streak my makeup right off my face. It blocked my pores, and I would break out every time I tried to use it. Maybe this works for some, but it was a NOPE for me.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: the product is great, it's doing his job and its clearly matte. But if you want it to hold all day long at either work or school, it won't stay on more than 6hrs.  If you're looking for a similar product but cheaper, the morphe jumbo setting spray is very good and the quality/price link is awesome.

reviews.review_title: effective, maybe use primer + setting powder, too!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: currently 18 with combo/oily skin (with a particularly oily t-zone with emphasis on the forehead and nose!). PLEASE keep in mind this is a partial review, as i got this without getting a primer or a setting powder of any kind. i give this a 4/5 stars for two reasons.  1. it doesn't feel like extra weight on my face? the fine dispersion makes it feel like there's no extra layer. and if it got on my hair somehow, i didn't notice it feeling crunchy!  2. the mattifying effect, the most important part of this spray, was immediate in my use. even as i used a more dewy foundation (i use the tirtir mask fit red cushion not sold in sephora), the mattifying effect still held up! :)  again, this is only 4/5 because it gave me the effect i expected--BUT i'm not giving it a full chance since i don't have a primer and setting powder to give it a strong structure to build off of for staying power. will be writing an updated review once i have time with a primer and setting powder (both probably being one/size, but we'll see!)
